name: Learning Content Data Quality Checklist
description: Standard DQC for evaluating learning course materials across structure, content quality, accessibility, and compliance dimensions.

items.requirement: Course must have clearly stated learning objectives
items.criteria: The document must contain a dedicated section or statement listing specific, measurable learning objectives or learning outcomes for the course.

items.requirement: Content must be organized into logical modules or sections
items.criteria: The document must have a clear hierarchical structure with distinct modules, sections, or chapters that follow a logical progression.

items.requirement: Each module must have an introduction and summary
items.criteria: Each major module or section should have an introductory paragraph explaining what will be covered and a summary or key takeaways section.

items.requirement: Content must be free of factual inaccuracies
items.criteria: The information presented must be accurate, up-to-date, and consistent throughout the document. Look for contradictory statements, outdated references, or unsupported claims.
Technical terms, acronyms, and domain-specific vocabulary must be used consistently throughout the document. Key terms should be defined on first use.

items.requirement: Content must include practical examples or case studies
items.criteria: The document must include real-world examples, case studies, scenarios, or practical exercises that illustrate the concepts being taught.

items.requirement: Assessment criteria must be clearly defined
items.criteria: The document must include clear assessment methods, evaluation criteria, or knowledge check questions aligned to the stated learning objectives.

items.requirement: Assessments must align with learning objectives
items.criteria: Every stated learning objective must have a corresponding assessment question, activity, or evaluation method that tests whether the objective has been met.

items.requirement: Content must use clear and accessible language
items.criteria: The text should be written at an appropriate reading level for the target audience. Avoid unnecessary jargon, and explain complex concepts in simple terms where possible.

items.requirement: Visual content must have text descriptions
items.criteria: All images, diagrams, charts, and tables must have associated text descriptions, captions, or alt-text equivalents that convey the same information.

items.requirement: Content must include proper citations and references
items.criteria: All external sources, data, statistics, and quoted material must be properly cited with a references section or bibliography.

items.requirement: Content must comply with organizational branding guidelines
items.criteria: The document must follow organizational branding standards including proper use of logos, color schemes, fonts, and document templates where applicable.

items.requirement: Content must include interactive or engagement elements
items.criteria: The document should include elements that promote learner engagement such as discussion questions, reflection prompts, activities, quizzes, or multimedia references.
The document must clearly state any prerequisites, prior knowledge requirements, or recommended preparation needed before starting the course.

items.requirement: Course must include target audience description
items.criteria: The document must clearly identify the intended target audience, their roles, experience levels, or any other relevant demographic information.
